Tables

STATIC TABLE

Column 1 Column 2 Column 3 Column 4 Column 5
Row1:Data1 Row1:Data2 Row1:Data3 Row1:Data4 Row1:Data5
Row2:Data1 Row2:Data2 Row2:Data3 Row2:Data4 Row2:Data5
Row3:Data1 Row3:Data2 Row3:Data3 Row3:Data4 Row3:Data5
Row4:Data1 Row4:Data2 Row4:Data3 Row4:Data4 Row4:Data5 
<table class="standard-table">
    <thead>
        <tr>
            <th><span>Column 1</span></th>
            <th><span>Column 2</span></th>
            <th><span>Column 3</span></th>
            <th><span>Column 4</span></th>
            <th><span>Column 5</span></th>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <td>Row1:Data1</td>
            <td>Row1:Data2</td>
            <td>Row1:Data3</td>
            <td>Row1:Data4</td>
            <td>Row1:Data5</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td>Row2:Data1</td>
            <td>Row2:Data2</td>
            <td>Row2:Data3</td>
            <td>Row2:Data4</td>
            <td>Row2:Data5</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td>Row3:Data1</td>
            <td>Row3:Data2</td>
            <td>Row3:Data3</td>
            <td>Row3:Data4</td>
            <td>Row3:Data5</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td>Row4:Data1</td>
            <td>Row4:Data2</td>
            <td>Row4:Data3</td>
            <td>Row4:Data4</td>
            <td>Row4:Data5</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>

</table>

Dynamic Table

 
<!-- HTML -->
<table class="standard-table" id="tableID">
</table>


/* JavaScript */
// Array of table columns
var columns = [
    {
        name: 'DC 1', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc1', // Key name of column
        sortable: true // Enable sorting for column
    },
    {
        name: 'DC 2', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc2', // Key name of column
        sortable: true, // Enable sorting for column
        defaultSort: true // Specify as initial sort for table
    },
    {
        name: 'Center Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc3', // Key name of column
        centerAlign: true // Center align column content
    },
    {
        name: 'Right Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc4', // Key name of column
        sortable: true, // Enable sorting for column
        rightAlign: true // Right align column content
    }
];

// Array of table rows
// Object keys must correspond to column key name
var rows = [
    {
        dc1: 'data1',
        dc2: 9,
        dc3: 'data6',
        dc4: '$22.83'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data4',
        dc2: 8,
        dc3: 'data9',
        dc4: '$10.10'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data3',
        dc2: 5,
        dc3: 'data4',
        dc4: '$07.77'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data7',
        dc2: 2,
        dc3: 'data9',
        dc4: '$13.37'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data2',
        dc2: 3,
        dc3: 'data7',
        dc4: '$40.38'
    }
];

// Initialize table via id and passing columns and rows
new Table('tableID').init(columns, rows);

Dynamic Table w/ Checkboxes

 
<!-- HTML -->
<table class="standard-table" id="tableID">
</table>


/* JavaScript */
// Array of table columns
var columns = [ ... ];

// Array of table rows
// Object keys must correspond to column key name
var rows = [ ... ];

// Create options object with showCheckboxes attribute
var options = {
	showCheckboxes: true,
    checkboxCallback: function() { ... } // Execute function whenever a checkbox is clicked, optional
};

// Initialize table via id and passing columns, rows, and options
new Table('tableID').init(columns, rows, options);

Then access the `checked` property for each item in the rows array.

Dynamic Table w/ Buttons

 
<!-- HTML -->
<table class="standard-table" id="tableID">
</table>


/* JavaScript */
// Array of table columns
var columns = [
    {
        name: 'DC 1', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc1', // Key name of column
        sortable: true // Enable sorting for column
    },
    {
        name: 'DC 2', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc2', // Key name of column
        sortable: true, // Enable sorting for column
        defaultSort: true // Specify as initial sort for table
    },
    {
        name: 'Center Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc3', // Key name of column
        centerAlign: true // Center align column content
    },
    {
        name: 'Right Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc4', // Key name of column
        sortable: true, // Enable sorting for column
        rightAlign: true // Right align column content
    },
    {
        name: 'center Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc5', // Key name of column
        centerAlign: true // Center align column content
        button: true // Enables buttons for column
    }
];

// Array of table rows
// Object keys must correspond to column key name
/** 
	Button rows accept an object with 4 properties
	label: label of button
	class: string of classes to be applied to button separated by spaces
	event: function that takes data property and is run when button is clicked
	data: accepts any input as a parameter for the event
*/
var rows = [
    {
        dc1: 'data1',
        dc2: 9,
        dc3: 'data6',
        dc4: '$22.83',
        dc5: { label: 'button1', class: 'primary sm', event: buttonCallback, data: 'callbackData'}
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data4',
        dc2: 8,
        dc3: 'data9',
        dc4: '$10.10',
        dc5: { label: 'button2', class: 'primary sm', event: buttonCallback, data: 'callbackData'}
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data3',
        dc2: 5,
        dc3: 'data4',
        dc4: '$07.77',
        dc5: { label: 'button3', class: 'primary sm', event: buttonCallback, data: 'callbackData'}
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data7',
        dc2: 2,
        dc3: 'data9',
        dc4: '$13.37',
        dc5: { label: 'button4', class: 'sm', event: buttonCallback, data: 'callbackData'}
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data2',
        dc2: 3,
        dc3: 'data7',
        dc4: '$40.38',
        dc5: { label: 'button5', class: 'sm', event: buttonCallback, data: 'callbackData'}
    }
];

// Function to be executed when button is clicked
var buttonCallback = function(data) {
	console.log(data);
};

// Initialize table via id and passing columns, rows
new Table('tableID').init(columns, rows);

Dynamic Table w/Filters

 
<!-- HTML -->
<table class="filter-table" id="tableID">
</table>


/* JavaScript */
// Array of table columns
var columns = [
    {
        name: 'DC 1', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc1', // Key name of column
        sortable: true // Enable sorting for column
    },
    {
        name: 'DC 2', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc2', // Key name of column
        sortable: true, // Enable sorting for column
        defaultSort: true, // Specify as initial sort for table
        filterPlaceholder: 'Custom Text' // Option to specify text in filter input
    },
    {
        name: 'Center Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc3', // Key name of column
        centerAlign: true, // Center align column content
        filterPlaceholder: ' ' // Option to specify empty text in filter input
    },
    {
        name: 'Right Align', // Display name of column
        key: 'dc4', // Key name of column
        sortable: true, // Enable sorting for column
        rightAlign: true // Right align column content
    }
];

// Array of table rows
// Object keys must correspond to column key name
var rows = [
    {
        dc1: 'data1',
        dc2: 9,
        dc3: 'data6',
        dc4: '$22.83'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data4',
        dc2: 8,
        dc3: 'data9',
        dc4: '$10.10'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data3',
        dc2: 5,
        dc3: 'data4',
        dc4: '$07.77'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data7',
        dc2: 2,
        dc3: 'data9',
        dc4: '$13.37'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data2',
        dc2: 3,
        dc3: 'data7',
        dc4: '$40.38'
    },
    {
        dc1: 'data77',
        dc2: 77,
        dc3: 'data77',
        dc4: '$77.77'
    }
];

// Initialize table via id and passing columns and rows
var fTable = new FilterTable('tableID');
fTable.init(columns, rows);

// To utilize a custom filter callback function
function callback(filters) {
    // filters is an array as follows
    [
        "columnkey": "searchvalue",
        "columnkey": "searchvalue",
        ...
    ]
    // Execute custom filtering/fetching data
    ...
    // Refresh table rows
    fTable.load(rows);
}
fTable.init(columns, rows, callback);
